contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} The '''ypotryll''' is a [[legendary creature]] featured in [[heraldry]]. It is a type of [[chimera (mythology)|chimera]] with the tusked head of a [[boar]], humped body of a [[camel]], legs and hooves of an [[ox]] or [[goat]] and tail of a [[Serpent (symbolism)|serpent]]. Its name probably derives from the Greek "hippo-", horse (cf. [[Middle English]] "ypotame", hippopotamus). [[Category:Medieval European legendary creatures]] [[Category:Heraldic beasts]] [[Category:Mythological hybrids]] {{Legendary-creature-stub}} {{Europe-myth-stub}} {{Heraldry-stub}}
